# SCSS Features Guide {.section-divider}

## Slide Classes Overview {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Basics
:::

### Main Slide Types

```markdown
## Title {.section-divider}
## Title {.title-slide}
## Title {.content-slide}
## Title {.definition-slide}
## Title {.image-slide}
## Title {.topics-slide}
## Title {.closing-slide}
```

::: {.info-box}
**Tip**: Use `.content-slide` with slug headers for most content slides
:::

---

## Section Divider Example {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Basics
:::

**Code:**
```markdown
# Section Title {.section-divider}
```

**Result:**
- Full-width gradient background (navy to blue)
- Centered white text
- Large, uppercase heading
- Perfect for major section breaks

---

## Slug Headers {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Demo
:::

**Code:**
```markdown
## Your Slide Title {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Section Name
:::

Content goes here...
```

**Features:**
- Black badge in top-right corner
- White text, rounded corners
- Shadow effect for depth
- Use consistently within sections

# Complete Examples {.section-divider}

## Example 1: Research Methods {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Methods
:::

### Data Collection Approaches

::: {.method-grid}
- **Self-report**: Questionnaires, interviews, diaries
- **Behavioral coding**: Video analysis, interaction coding
- **Physiological**: Heart rate, skin conductance, fMRI
- **Performance**: Accuracy, reaction time, error rates
- **Linguistic**: LIWC, sentiment analysis, NLP
- **Machine learning**: Classifiers on multimodal data
:::

::: {.warning-box}
**Methodological Consideration**

Always consider the ecological validity and ethical implications of your chosen methods
:::

---

## Example 2: Literature Review {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Literature
:::

### Key Theoretical Perspectives

::: {.key-points}
- **Cognitive Load Theory**: Explains information processing limitations
- **Dual Process Theory**: Distinguishes automatic vs. controlled processes
- **Social Exchange Theory**: Analyzes cost-benefit in relationships
- **Attribution Theory**: How we explain behavior and events
:::

::: {.references-small}
@kahneman2011; @sweller1988; @heider1958; @kelley1967
:::

# Tips & Best Practices {.section-divider}

## General Guidelines {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Best Practices
:::

### Do's ✓

::: {.success-box}
**Recommended Practices**

- Use slug headers consistently within sections
- Match box colors to content type (warning, success, info)
- Keep lists concise (5-7 items max)
- Use `.smaller` for dense content
- Include references at bottom of slides
:::

---

## What to Avoid {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Best Practices
:::

### Don'ts ✗

::: {.warning-box}
**Things to Avoid**

- Don't mix too many box types on one slide
- Don't use section dividers for regular content
- Don't forget to add `.content-slide` with slug headers
- Don't overcrowd slides - use multiple slides instead
- Don't use slug headers on title or closing slides
:::

---

## Consistency Tips {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Best Practices
:::

::: {.highlight-box}
**Maintain Visual Consistency**

1. Use the same slug header text for all slides in a section
2. Choose one list style per content type and stick with it
3. Reserve colored boxes for truly important information
4. Use columns when comparing two distinct concepts
5. Keep color coding meaningful throughout
:::

---

## Accessibility {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Best Practices
:::

::: {.info-box}
**Built-in Accessibility Features**

- High contrast color schemes
- Reduced motion support for animations
- Keyboard navigation friendly
- Screen reader compatible structure
- Clear visual hierarchy
:::

# Quick Reference Table {.section-divider}

## Class Reference {.content-slide .smaller}

::: {.slug-header}
Reference
:::

| Class | Purpose | Use Case |
|-------|---------|----------|
| `.section-divider` | Major section breaks | Chapter/topic transitions |

| `.slug-header` | Section indicator | Top-right badge |
| `.key-points` | Important lists | Core concepts |
| `.findings-list` | Research results | Empirical findings |
| `.detection-methods` | Methods list | Approaches/techniques |
| `.warning-box` | Cautions | Limitations/concerns |
| `.key-insight` | Takeaways | Main points |
| `.topic-grid` | Numbered topics | Project/assignment lists |

## Color Guide {.content-slide}

::: {.slug-header}
Reference
:::

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}

- Navy: Primary/headings
